department.dept_long_name: Department of Slavic Languages and Literatures

course.title: Moscow and St. Petersburg
course.description: Explores the literary and cultural histories of Russia's two capital cities, their "urban geographies" and representations in visual and performing arts. Includes Pushkin, Gogol, Dostoevsky, Tolstoy, Chekhov, Bely, Zamyatin, Bunin, Bulgakov, Nabokov, Erofeev, Bitov, Tolstaya, Pelevin, Sokurov, Balabanov, Bekmambetov.
course.notes: All readings in English. No prior knowledge of Russian literature or history necessary. Students who wish to read Russian texts in the original may arrange a special section with the instructor.
